chunks.text: Planner contracts for text task input require two to three executable steps in the generated plan.
Dispatch lane supports resume retries and rework attempts with explicit retry counters in runtime state.
Acceptance requires report.md, verification.log, and audit-summary.md outputs with deterministic artifact structure.
RetrievalPolicyConfig includes top_k, min_relevance_score, and allow_global_fallback controls for query filtering.
Release readiness checks run with make release-check and write summary JSON plus verification evidence logs.
Verification logs must keep parser-compatible markers: COMMAND ENTRY START END and Command lines.
Runtime policy keeps LangGraph as default while legacy runtime remains maintenance-only without new features.
EmbeddingProvider supports local/token-signature and local/char-trigram plus optional openai/text-embedding-3-small.
Test mode must stay deterministic and use deterministic hash fixture embeddings for regression stability.
Production retrieval should avoid toy hash vectors and instead rely on provider-backed local embeddings.
Deterministic index rebuild sorts by task run path and chunk order before persisting stable JSON keys.
Compatibility guardrails preserve schema_version 1.0.0 semantics, v1.0.0-rc1 anchors, and final-run topology.
If scoped retrieval has no hits, policy can allow global fallback search for troubleshooting context.
Reliability gate uses make gate-reliability-readiness and checks continuity assertions before release decisions.
DKT-061 benchmark requires ten to twenty representative queries and top-k retrieval quality metrics per backend.

description: Representative DAOKit retrieval benchmark set for embedding backend comparison.

queries.query: How many executable steps should planner output for text task input?
Which command runs release-check and writes summary json?
What markers keep verification log parser-compatible?
What is the runtime default and what is legacy runtime policy?
Which local embedding candidates are supported by EmbeddingProvider?
Which backend keeps test mode deterministic for regression tests?
How does production retrieval differ from toy hash vectors?
Which retrieval policy fields control top-k threshold and fallback behavior?
How is deterministic index rebuild guaranteed?
Which compatibility anchors must remain unchanged for v1.3?
Why does DKT-061 need a 10 to 20 query benchmark with top-k metrics?
Which required acceptance artifacts must every run produce?
